subject: Writing
title: Harriet Beecher Stowe Shakes a Nation
description: A 60-second lesson on Harriet Beecher Stowe Shakes a Nation.

hook.text: Lincoln reportedly told Stowe: 'So you're the little woman who wrote the book that started this great war.'

buildup.text: Uncle Tom's Cabin, published in 1852, depicted the horrors of slavery for a mass audience.

discovery.text: It sold 300,000 copies in its first year â€” the best-selling novel in 19th-century America.

twist.text: The South banned it. Thirty anti-Tom novels were published in response. It split a country in half.

climax.text: Historians argue the book accelerated the abolitionist movement and helped trigger the Civil War.

punchline.text: One novel rewrote a nation's conscience.

quiz.question: How many copies did Uncle Tom's Cabin sell in its first year?
